I look forward to reviewing the recommendations of @January6thCmte on how we can best preserve and protect our Democracy. It is our duty to the Constitution and the American people to get to the truth and ensure that such an assault on our Democracy never happens again.

The House has already taken important steps to protect the right to vote by passing the John Lewis #VotingRightsAdvancementAct and the #ForThePeople Act. But those pieces of legislation alone are not sufficient to prevent the next attempt to overturn the will of the voters.

The Big Lie has been used as pretext all over the country for rampant efforts to suppress the ability to vote, to install election officials willing to openly ignore the legal votes of the people, and to enact other mechanisms to overturn the results of future elections.

Sadly, the threat to our Democracy is ongoing. Adherence to the former president‚Äôs ‚ÄòBig Lie‚Äô about the 2020 election is now the most important litmus test for my colleagues on the other side of the aisle.

While we were not deterred from fulfilling our constitutional duty, it still concerns me that just hours after this violent insurrection so many of my colleagues ‚Äì 147 to be exact ‚Äìvoted to overturn the legally cast votes of millions of our fellow Americans.

The Capitol Police force was overwhelmed. Members of Congress, congressional staff, reporters, and support personnel were forced to hide from the violent mob storming and ransacking our Capitol. Several individuals lost their lives, including multiple police officers.
Today marks the 1 year anniversary of the violent assault on the US Capitol. https://t.co/TvaYpXEtzc
